channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves Jamaica devastated. And, the shutdown's impact on airports
item.description: Officials are assessing the damage after Hurricane Melissa made landfall in Jamaica as a Category 5. And, how the government shutdown is impacting air...

item.title: Greetings from high up in Colombia's Andes, where 'prairie-style meat' is a delicacy
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: White House fires entire commission that reviews designs for federal buildings
item.description: The White House has fired all six members of the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts, the independent federal agency that reviews design plans for monuments,...

item.title: Teens who use weed before age 15 have more trouble later, a study finds
item.description: Young teens who use cannabis are more likely to be frequent users than people who start later, according to a study in JAMA Network Open. They are als...

item.title: Israel says it's resuming the ceasefire after its strikes in Gaza kill over 100 people
item.description: Israel's military said the ceasefire in Gaza resumed after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight that killed 104 people, including 46 children, ac...

item.title: Raid on gang in Rio leaves over 100 people dead, including police officers
item.description: The police operation was one of the most violent in Brazil's recent history, with human rights organizations calling for investigations into the death...

item.title: Israeli strikes in Gaza kill 104, health ministry says, after Hamas accused of killing soldier
item.description: US President Trump says "nothing" will jeopardise the two-week-old ceasefire despite the flare-up of violence.

item.title: Federal trial to start over Trumpâ€™s efforts to deploy the National Guard in Portland, Oregon
item.description: A federal trial over whether President Donald Trump can deploy the National Guard to Portland, Oregon, is set to begin Wednesday.

item.title: At least 132 killed in Rio police raid, officials say
item.description: The police operation targeting a criminal gang in a densely-populated area of Rio is the deadliest in the city.

item.title: "Extremely dangerous" Hurricane Melissa lashing Cuba after pounding Jamaica
item.description: Hurricane Melissa made landfall over eastern Cuba early Wednesday as an "extremely dangerous" Category 3 storm, forecasters said, after pummeling Jama...

item.title: 10/29: CBS Morning News
item.description: Hurricane Melissa moves into Cuba as Jamaica surveys catastrophic damage; Microsoft and OpenAI announce a restructuring deal.

item.title: Jamaicans start to reveal devastation as hurricane causes floods, power cuts and splits city in two
item.description: With communication networks in Jamaica crippled, the true scale of the disaster remains unknown.

item.title: Sudan's military expels top UN food aid officials as conflict escalates
item.description: Two WFP officials are give 72 hours to leave without explanation - days after a key city falls to the RSF.

item.title: US will reduce its troops on Nato's eastern flank, Romania says
item.description: Bucharest said between 900 and 1,000 American troops would remain stationed in Romania - down from 1,700.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa barrels towards the Bahamas
item.description: Hurricane Melissa is headed toward the Bahamas after ripping through Jamaica and making landfall in Cuba. CBS News' Jason Allen has the latest from Ki...

item.title: OpenAI strikes major deal with Microsoft
item.description: OpenAI and Microsoft reached a deal to complete the startup's shift to for-profit. Jason Hiner, editor in chief for ZDNET, joins to break down the dea...

item.title: Judge orders daily meetings with Border Patrol official Bovino on Chicago immigration crackdown
Court disqualifies Trump-appointed US attorney from overseeing multiple criminal cases
